intro: Chamaesciadium morphologicum, commonly known as the mountain lily, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, providing a striking visual contrast to its floral display. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
